If you do not find a match after a few minutes, please restart your search.” A process that may seem cumbersome for many who were under the impression that Microsoft's cloud-based Azure platform would make for a smooth launch. I just like to imagine logging on and playing Halo 2 with friendos is like having a hard poo. The first 15 minutes might be painful, but once you've defeated the corn filled monstrosity, no victory feels grander.Onto better news, Nintendo has already confirmed the launch of the next wave of amiibo following the Loot Crate partnership we discussed yesterday. Scheduled for a release window in February of 2015, Nintendo will bring an additional 11 figurines to the toy lineup, making for a total 27 toys in the pipeline. The newest members include; Toon Link, Sheik, Ike, Shulk, Lucario, Meta Knight, King Dee Dee Dee, Rosalina, Bowser, Sonic and Mega Man. With characters like Sonic and Mega Man in the mix, I feel it is pretty clear the third party support Nintendo might be looking for in the future. Let's just hope the next games in those respective franchises are also fun to play. I'm looking at you Sonic Boom.One issue we weren't aware of is the limited functionality of these amiibo. As observed by CVG on the Japanese amiibo page, the official description says an amiibo may only store data for a single game at a time. That won't affect Mario Kart or Hyrule Warriors since you're basically unlocking content using an amiibo, but as more games provide some sort of persistent character, you might have to pick and chose. Or you could just buy dups of the same amiibo for multiple games if you don't want to lose your data. So, Nintendo of America… You going to mention this at all before the launch on the 21st? Or are you just going to sodomize us?And finally, secrets and rumors surrounding Just Cause 3 have lead to all sorts of rampant speculation, but it looks like the wait is finally over. Game Informer has revealed Just Cause 3 as the cover story for the December issue and they'll be handling up on a month of exclusive news surrounding the property. Avalanche Studios' New York City office has been working on the game for the past three years and it looks like it is about ready for public consumption. Since this is a tease for a wealth of content being parsed out over the next month, there aren't many details, but there are some clarifications. According to co-founder Christofer Sundberg, Just Cause 3 will launch in 2015 on PC, Xbone, and PS4. Also, "it is not a Free To Play game” and "it does not feature in-game microtransactions.” I expect all manner of chaotic grappling, explosive mayhem, and gorgeous tropical vistas are awaiting us. For the authority on all things Just Cause, here's special guest Nick Cramer!Thanks Nick! I'll make sure to get you that ambulance as soon as this episode is over.Our comment of the day comes from SomeDUMG4MER… that's his name… I ugh, don't actually think you're stupid… who asks, "why are you guys in LA?” I don't Know SomeDUMG4MER. The last thing I remember was having a few drinks and then I woke up three days later in the underside of a Greyhound Bus with this mustache. I guess I live here now?Anyway, I'm Sean and that was Hard News!

attributes.title: AC Unity Glitches Hurt Stock, Sonic Boom Dance Party, Game of Thrones Details | Hard News 11/12/14
attributes.description: I'm Sean Hinz and this is Hard News for Wednesday November 12th, 2014Really quick, Bloodborne has been delayed into March of 2015 because of Alpha feedback. That pushes out the launch to the 24th, roughly a month later. :-(Good Old Games is having a massive sale today in celebration of the Fall season and that means deep discounts on DRM-free games. Most are half-price, while some have dropped by nearly 90%! That's not all, because there are two ways to get yourself some free games as well. For the next 48 hours you can get Mount and Blade for free just by logging into GOG. And if one free game isn't enough, you can go a click a Witcher 2 banner once for seven days, anytime over the next two weeks and you'll get a free copy of that game, plus a movie called The Gamers. Thanks PC master race!Onto more great gaming news, Game of Thrones Ironrath from the adventure game masters over at Telltale has finally had some more information revealed regarding its 2014 launch. Episode one should release before the end of the year on Xbox 360, PS3, and PC; with the additional platforms like PS4, Xbox One, Mac, and iOS coming later. The story will focus in the north of Westeros and players will be jumping into the boots of five members of the House Forrester. They are keepers of the Wolfswood, a forest of ironwood trees which fall under the banner of house Stark. You'll still travel to iconic locations like the Kings Landing and The Wall, but much of the story will play out between House Forrester and their rivals, House Whitewall. The first episode's title is based on the Forrester House motto, Iron from Ice. No word on an official release, which is discouraging considering there are six weeks left in the year… I blame George RR Martin for the delay. GIVE ME BOOK SIX YOU BULBOUS BASTARD!As a palate cleanse from my justifiable rage, let's check out the dance party going on right now at Amy Rose's house.Uploaded by Cyberman65, What you just witnessed was the reward for collecting all the Badges from Sonic Boom: Shattered Crystal. Badges, which are necessary to unlock all the stages and track you general progress, so you'd hope for a big reward. That was what you got instead… Will someone please just shoot Sonic in the face already?And finally, it appears that everyone had a rough launch yesterday because Assassin's Creed Unity is not reviewing that well. Inspite of it's ambition visuals and unique setting, the game is plagued with glitches. I myself experienced one last night when I tried moving left on a ledge and the frame rate plummeted. There is also a ton of texture pop, the occasional open world jank, and general malaise surrounding the annualized franchise. Leading to a 10% drop in the value of Ubisoft's stock yesterday. It went from $3.62, down to $3.29, but opened today at $3.42. It seems like it might have settled, but frankly it is the laughing stock of much of the Internet right now. Yahoo Finance editor Tae Kim says Ubisoft would have been better off delaying the game a few months rather than "Assassin's Creed Unity is reminding gamers of EA's Battlefield 4 launch problems last year.” Awww snap! Yahoo Finance be talking shit. What now Ubi? WHAT NOW?!For the sake of a shameless plug, I will be streaming an entire playthrough of Unity on my personal channels, so join me on my Twitch & YouTube linked in the description for all manner of glitches. Our comment of the day comes from Inferno Bear who asked "Sean Whats the Game that Made you Want to be involved in Gaming as a Job?”

attributes.title: Mario Kart 8 Zelda DLC, new Mercedes Mario ads, useless PS Vita peripheral | Hard News 11/13/14
attributes.description: I'm Sean Hinz and this is Hard New for Thursday November 13th, 2014.Members of EA Access are having a very good day, because Dragon Age: Inquisition is arriving a bit early, in the form of a trial. Subscribers to the Xbox One exclusive service is delivering on its promises with access to the first six hours of this massive RPG, a whole five days before release. Progress will carry over to the main game, so EA is kind of like your pusher, who for $5 per month, will get you hooked on all the latest EA properties. Sounds like Inquisition might just be the perfect drug.Speaking of addictions, Mario Kart 8 has dropped its first chunk of DLC for all of you fuel heads out there. It's sort of a landmark event for the franchise by not only offering up additional courses, karts, and characters; but featuring crossover content from franchises like The Legend of Zelda and Excitebike. An update will accompany the DLC, adding amiibo support and unlocking the on-disc DLC racing suits for your Miis. In other Mario Kart news, unrelated to the DLC, Nintendo of Japan and Mercedes again teamed up to make a couple more of those bizarre commercials for the GLA. This time featuring Princess Peach and a poppin' and lockin' Luigi. The commercials don't really make we want to buy a car, but they do make me want to move to Japan. What a kooky place…In more offbeat ideas from the land of the rising sun, a Japanese developer is taking a crack at making a peripheral for Sony's recently released PlayStation TV. The incredibly small device is getting a rather large docking station called the DekaVita 7, that essentially turns your microconsole into a PlayStation Vita. It adds analog nubs, a 7-inch screen without touch support, and costs about $230. Making it the least useful portable in the history of hardware considering that the Vita already exists and has more features. While I am sure it is completely functional, it still begs the question, why?????While that offbeat product was coming from a third-party, PlayStation is having its own issues regarding their newest micro console. Just today the hardware giant revealed the PlayStation Vue, their TV streaming service for the PS3 and PS4. But the PlayStation TV is noticeably absent from their lineup of supported hardware. The cloud-based subscription service will start broadcasting in 2015 and deliver on demand content from NBC, Scripps Network Interactive, Discovery, Viacom, FOX, and CBS. But Sony's service has done little to differentiate itself from other players in that business like Hulu or Amazon. Long-term they will support iPad and "more Sony and non-Sony devices.” Theoretically that means PlayStation TV won't be far behind, but I can't think of a product I've had more buyers remorse for than that damn microconsole.And we end today's news with footage of a flaccid penis in Far Cry 4. It's a bit blurry, but finally gender equality has come to gaming!Today's comment of the day comes from thistlewayman "Sean why do you look down on me today, I thought we were on equal footing.....” In the case of yesterday's "interesting” camera angle, you can thank Nick Cramer and John Francis McCullagh who claimed everything looked fine on their end when we shot the episode. I've included their Twitter accounts in the description, I think you know what to do.As always be sure to like this episode, share it with your closest friends and subscribe to our YouTube channel.I'm Sean and THAT was Hard News!It's time for another episode of Five Fun Facts featuring Grim Fandago. A fact that may not be in that episode is one concerning the upcoming PlayStation Experience in Vegas. The scuttlebutt around the Internet is that the remastered version will be playable to the public for the first time. Until then, watch this episode and satiate your hunger for knowledge and adventure!

attributes.title: Pikachu Battlepad, Game of Thrones Leak, amiibo Crated, Majesco Hurt | Hard News 11/17/14
attributes.description: I'm Sean Hinz and this is Hard News for Monday November 17th, 2014The actual details for the three exclusive amiibo crates from the Nintendo & Loot Crate partnership arrived over the weekend. It isn't as great of a deal as fans would have hoped, but there are some perks to using the program. Three payments of $55 will get these delivered straight to your door over the next six weeks. The first crate includes Donkey Kong, Mario, Kirby and Pikachu; plus a mini-magazine, sticker, and wristband. Then you have Fox, Yoshi, Peach, and Samus in the second crate; plus another mini-magazine and cinch bag. Finally, the third crate will include Luigi and Zelda, a third mini-magazine and some super rare t-shirt. It's limited edition type stuff, for nearly $35 more, instead of buying the figurines for $130 individually. Considering they already sold out, I bet Nintendo is more than happy with the decision.Another decision I imagine Nintendo be happy about is the creation of yet another fight pad for the upcoming release of Smash. We know about PDP making four exclusive pads for launch alongside the Wii U fighter, plus the Gamecube adapter coming from the Big N themselves. Now Hori is getting on the hype train with the release of the electric mouse inspired Pikachu themed fight pad. It looks just like the Gamcube-style controller of yester-year and connects through a Wiimote which can also rock a matching cover. It appears this may be a Japanese exclusive for now, but Hori is also selling Mario and Luigi themed fight pads here in the states. There are a number of ways to get your Smash on this holiday season, without having to use that dumbass nunchuck. Thank god for that!Not everything about today can be good news though, as Majesco & Midnight City may be in financial trouble. Having long avoided being delisted from the stock exchange, Majesco invested heavily in their indie branch Midnight City this past year, alongside external re-branding. But after losing the Zumba fitness license and underperforming in the indie space, they have filed a damning report with the SEC. In the documentation Majesco concludes they "have suffered losses that raise substantial doubt about their [our] ability to continue…” Therefore, they "are evaluating various alternatives, including reducing operating expenses and personnel costs, securing additional financing for future business activities, and other strategic alternatives including a sale or merger of their [our] company." Having also sold off the majority stake in GMS, a social casino game developer, Midnight City is pretty much the only thing they have going and that doesn't look good. Here's hoping everyone over there at the publisher is ready for whatever comes next.And finally, the next big thing that we know almost nothing about is the Game of Thrones tie-in from Telltale Games. But according to Kotaku, a Twitter account focused on XBLA leaked a handful of screenshots that weren't officially revealed by Telltale. As we discussed last week, it will put you in the roll of numerous members of House Forrester, but some fan favorites will be making an appearance. Already Cersi and Tyrion are confirmed if the screens are indeed real and the art-style looks all too familiar coming from that developer. Don't forget that we should also be paying a visit to the Wall, which means John Snow will also make a guest appearance, but will Stannis be there and will we get to see Melisandre's boobs? I guess we'll have to keep speculating and Chad says go read the books.Today's comment of the day comes from DylanYoshi who says "Blargh, nothing "begs" a question. Begging a question is a logical fallacy. The phrase is "raises a question". This is slightly bothersooooome!” I realize I might have ended last week's Vita news with a circular argument, but I don't think you're a real Yoshi and that makes you a liar. And yes that was a Red Herring, look it up. And while you're there, don't forget to like, share, subscribe.I'm Sean and THAT was Hard News!Check out a piece of sponsored content where Chad and Paker introduce us to the wonders of DC Universe Online and the newest superhero, Foxitron. I think it's some sort of savior of the Furries, but you'll have to watch the episode to find out if that's the case.

attributes.title: FF7 in LittleBigPlanet, Goat Simulator MMO, G4 is Dead... Really! | Hard News 11/18/14
attributes.description: I'm Sean Hinz and this is Hard News for Tuesday November 18th, 2014.    If you missed the most glorious simulation of the modern age, don't fret, Goat Simulator is getting an expansion of epic proportions and there is plenty of time left to enjoy it. The MMO-themed expansion pokes fun at taking this physics simulation to the extreme by dropping your hairy ass into a fantasy themed universe complete with thatch roof cottages and idiotic villagers. No one suspects a thing as this mighty goat dons one of his many new armors to lead the village into oblivion. Oh and you can play as a microwave with legs. The expansion drops this Thursday on Steam and will cost zero dollars, so if you can't afford the new Dragon Age, then you should definitely check out the new Goat Simulator.    On the subject of epic RPGs being smashed into a non-role playing game, did you hear about this Final Fantasy 7 thing? A creator named Jamie Colliver gave up the past two years of his life in order to faithfully recreate the entire Final Fantasy 7 experience in LittleBigPlanet 2. Now obviously it isn't a perfect re-creation mechanically, the genres are completely different. But from the aesthetic to its story beats, you can enjoy the game in its entirety, including side missions, across 31 levels. You can also play it in LittleBigPlanet 3 on the PS3, PS4, and Vita which just released today. And for fans who don't own the game, consider popping in on Colliver's YouTube for over a hundred videos documenting his experience and his slow descent into madness. Or at least that what I would imagine spending two years in sack world would be like.    Speaking of crazy people, someone out there thinks that G4 is still a channel. Originally closing up shop in 2012, the gaming-centric tech channel was set to be reborn as the Esquire network in 2013. That apparently fell through, but by then, us gamers and much of the G4 staff had all moved on with their lives. So then it went back to playing re-runs of Cops under the name G4 and it was basically 2010 all over again, but with less viewership. I think it was only running in Kansas if the source of this article is to be understood. Anyway, someone at NBC Universal is getting off their ass to finally kill the poor bastard on November 20th. So let's all have a moment of silence for the reanimated corpse of G4 as it takes a shotgun blast to the face.  Ahhh... That's better!    Our comment of the day comes from Nathan Dunn who says ""Man... How I wish Nintendo would make a Wii U Pro Controller shaped like a Gamecube controller. I love the shape and feel of the Gamecube controller, but don't want cables. Plugging it into a Wii remote is just as clumsy as being tethered to the console. I want a wireless Gamecube controller with the 30 hour rechargeable that the pro controller has..."" Dude, Nathan. Buy a Wavebird. I put the Amazon link in the description.    I'm Sean and THAT was Hard News!    Thanks for sticking around for another Hard News. If you enjoyed that sweet ass CG fire from yesterday, go watch our Destiny in-real life video. It has plenty of other special effects like a flying dolphin and teleportation. Now that's pretty damn cool!

attributes.title: Walmart Scammed, Far Cry 4 Pirated, Ubisoft Dishonors France? | Hard News 11/19/14
attributes.description: I'm Sean Hinz and this is Hard News for Hump Day November 19th, 2014.  In a clever move by Ubisoft, Far Cry 4 pirates have made themselves known publicly by complaining on social media. Whether intentional or not, the field of view scroller was left out of the retail build, only to be patched in on day one. So when users took to Twitter to complain about the option, game director Alex Hutchinson made it clear to PC players that ""if you're online complaining about the lack of FOV control ... You pirated the game.” In my opinion, THAT makes you an asshole.  But Ubi isn't free from dawning such an auspicious title themselves, but this time it is coming from their country of origin. Former Presidential candidate Jean-Luc Mélenchon has been critical of Assassin's Creed Unity, calling the game ""propaganda” and claims it portrays Maximilien Robespierre as a ""monster”, despite being the catalyst of victory for the people in the revolution. Mélenchon concluded that the game ""presents an image of hatred of the Revolution, hatred of the people, hatred of the republic which is rampant in the far-right milieux (of today).""Here's the thing Jean-Luc... You imply this game is unpatriotic, but based on the polls, it has had more support of the French people than you did in the last election.  Now the devs behind the game have been learning a lesson or two with the recent launch of AssCreed having so many bugs. The face-off issue affecting PC players should no longer be an issue. It appears it was tied to specific GPU, but has since been resolved. Still there are larger performance issues from the framerate dropping, to awful pop-in and the process of getting everything fixed look promising. Based on feedback, Ubi says they are trying to streamline free-running, tagging objects and prioritizing core utilization. All of these things combined will improve the overall experience. While we don't have timeline for the third patch, the devs are on it and hopeful. But will they get around to fixing the Initiates system? Because no one is mentioning that and it is basically useless.  And finally, Walmart is out thousands of dollars after scammers get the best of them. Thanks to their fairly open-ended price matching policy, customers began using Amazon to generate some deep discounts on PS4 that weren't actually real. But Walmart didn't know that. So when a customer went in with a print out of an Amazon sales page offering up a PS4 for $90, what choice did the retailer have but to honor the promotion. It looks like the opportunity circulated online for a day or two before people started bragging about their victories on social media and utlimately making the big box retailer aware of their mistake. Some might blame the employees for not verifying the promotion, but considering they're one of the poor bastards who have to work on Thanksgiving, I say karmas a bitch. Kind of funny that no one tried to scam Walmart for an Xbox One, huh?   Our comment of the day comes from ajtwista92 who says, ""Is it me or is Sean slowly turning into Monetary Jack from Chip and Dale Rescue Rangers? He just needs to gain 50-60 pounds, a blue turtleneck, and an overcoat.” I uhhh… Don't know what you're talking about. CHEEEESE!!!  I'm Jack and THAT was Hard News!  We're back for another episode of Sidescrollers. This time Chad, Sam, and Craig show off our new set; while they talk about SGC dates, a crazy few weeks of broken games, and a Florida story or two. Man that new set sure looks sweet. If only I could have a podcast on it…

attributes.title: Meta Knight amiibo, Xbox One Birthday, Final Fantasy Games Coming | Hard News 11/20/14
attributes.description: I'm Sean Hinz and this is Hard News for Thursday November 20th, 2014.EA has announced a new Need for Speed game, called Need for Speed No Limits and it will be releasing in 2015 on… mobile devices. Specifically iOS and Android. It's good to know since we can all stop caring about another free-to-play cash cow for EA. Frankly, this isn't the Need for Speed we're looking for. Let's try this new game announcement thing again…Square Enix has announced a new Final Fantasy game, three in fact and they're all for mobile devices… Dammit!  Final Fantasy Legends – Crystal of Time, Final Fantasy Brave Exvius, and the Final Fantasy Portal App are all destined for iOS and Android in 2015. Crystal of Time is a "time-traveling RPG” and looks like it might actual be trying to bring a true Final Fantasy game to mobile. That is until you read about the free-to-play part… Brave Exvius is a collaboration with the mobile developer behind the hit Brave Frontier. It looks much like Crystal of Time, but the systems and plot will probably feel different enough. It will also be free-to-play with microtransactions. Now the Portal App is part game, part rewards program and will tie-in to your Square Enix ID. It features the latest Final Fantasy news, swag, and aims to provide users the opportunity to earn points that can be exchanged for digital content. But the game element comes in the form of the Triple Triad card game from Final Fantasy 8. Which is one of the worst mini-games ever in the franchises history and I am so done talking about mobile games today. Oh and the Final Fantasy committee is high on Ether if they think this is the way to keep my loyalty. How about a new Tactics game? Please?!Speaking of begging for acknowledgment, Microsoft is giving Early Adopters of the Xbox One a few gifts to celebrate the year one anniversary. So on the 22nd you can log into Xbox Live for a free Year One gamer pic, background, background image, an exclusive Day One achievement background, plus free rentals of Halo 4: Forward Unto Dawn & Dragon Ball Z: Battle of the Gods. The only catch is that you'll have to have purchased the console before November 11th, be at least 17 years old, and have logged 10 hours on your Xbox One. There is even a sweepstakes for a bunch of different prizes ranging from physical Call of Duty bundles, to digital content for a bunch first-party titles and a few third-party games as well. That's pretty cool, but will I be able to find my free stuff using Google Maps in the shitty UI?No idiot, you'll use Bing maps and never find it.And lastly, fans of Meta Knight won't be able to find his amiibo counterpart anywhere but at your local Best Buy. Scheduled to debut in 2015 according to the big box retailer, this is the second exclusive for the figurines. GameStop has the original exclusive with Shulk. I suspect Toys R Us and Amazon will be getting their own exclusives in time. But more than anything, Smash fans seem to be more upset with the exclusivity of MewTwo in the upcoming fighter. You see, you will only unlock him if you own both copies of Smash. Many have dug into the fine print on the upcoming fighter and whether or not you can purchase him outright. It appears Nintendo may offer him as a piece of paid DLC sometime in the future, but Sakurai told Videogamer.com something different. As far as he is concerned there is no plans for Smash DLC and MewTwo is an experiment for content distribution. Sakurai worries about backlash from the community for "cutting up content to sell characters one by one”. So for now, the roster ends with MewTwo. This is contrary to some rumors we heard of potential Smash DLC in the future like Ice Climbers or the Rhythm Heaven's Chorus Men. If you had a choice, what DLC characters would you see added? Let us know in the comments.Today's comment comes from Corey Huffman who says "I hate ps4 what do people have against Xbox one:(" Hey buddy, real talk for a minute. I don't hate any of these consoles or publishers. In fact, I think my Xbox One has way better first party games than my PS4 right now. But when companies make dumb decisions, I am not afraid to call them out on it. So don't think we here at ScrewAttack hate Microsoft, Nintendo, or Sony. We just really like making fun of them.I'm Sean and THAT was Hard News.I loved that you watched this episode of Hard News, but you really need to get over to our Twitch for 24 hours of Super Smash Bros. The staff is ready for the midnight launch and we'll start by streaming the classics at 6 PM CST, featuring free prizes, and a few bruised egos. Just click this window to my left for Final Destination, no items, Fox only.

attributes.title: Blood Sport Kickstarter, StarCraft II Pro Disqualified, Hackers, Plays.TV | Hard News 11/24/14
attributes.description: I'm Sean Hinz and this is Hard News for Monday, November 24th, 2014.A female eSports competitor was threatened at a StarCraft 2 Tournament over the weekend. Ukranian StarCraft player Mihaylo Hayda tweeted "Going to rape some girl soon #fragbitemasters” in the middle of a qualifying match. Specifically referencing his opponent, Madeleine Leander, who recounted her experience to the site eSport. She noticed something was up when a "few minutes into the first map the game was paused.... because of the tweet.” Madeliene found it scary to see this sort of behavior coming from a pro player, but acknowledged the organization did what it could and ultimately disqualified Hayda from the tourney. Hayda later apologized for his behavior and took a hiatus from Twitter for a couple days noting he was "really ashamed” and "wanted to kill himself”. Based on that last tweet, it seems like he really learned something that day.On the other hand, people have yet to figure out that some crazy Kickstarter ideas, should stay crazy ideas. Blood Sport is a new technology being crowdfunded that incorporates the charitable act of donating blood and combine it with the fun of gaming. The tech uses an Arduino Board to make sure the blood is being sucked from your body and that you don't lose too much while playing. The issue here is that blood is drawn intravenously based on when the controller rumbles, so everytime you're shot, you'll lose a bit of blood. Now the crowdfunding campaign has just started and the team behind Blood Sport are looking for about 250,000 Canadian dollars, but have yet to clear $5K. You can head over to the kickstarter and toss your loonies in with the rest of ‘em, and help this group of secret vampire developers establish their new world order.Onto more crazy news, Raptr is trying to compete with MLG.TV and Twitch by opening their own streaming service, Plays.TV. It is currently in open beta and let's you share some of your best gaming moments with friends, using the social service. There is even some PC specific software that will allow you to capture your gameplay more easily. I think more competition for streaming platforms is great, but considering Twitch came integrated into both PS4 and Xbox One, the battle for supremacy is already over.And lastly, PSN was HACKED again! Along with some other stuff. Maybe. Kind of sort of? Or... not at all. You see, this past Friday a hacker collective known as DERP claimed they had stolen information from millions of users in Xbox Live, PSN,and even EA's Origin platform. They then posted on Twitter a few thousand of these usernames and information for public consumption. That content was very quickly taken down and the Twitter account went dark, but there hadn't been clarification on what actually happened. Sony has come forward after digging into the report and claims that no such intrusion has occurred. From their perspective, PlayStation takes "these reports very seriously and will continue to monitor our [their] network closely." For now, it looks like this may have dodged a bullet, but stay vigilant g1s, hackers are everywhere. Isn't that right Feminist Hacker Barbie?!Our comment of the day comes from TouchyBanana who says "why only 4 Hard News a week now? I thought there was one for each day except Saturday and Sunday Sean should be replaced with someone else?”. Fine. But it won't make you happy knowing there will only be three episodes this week, because it's Thanksgiving. It's an American where we eat more food than normal, while thanking the indigenous Americans for letting us steal their country.I'm Sean and THAT was Hard News.If you hadn't already been joining us for our latest livestream of Far Cry 4, man are you missing out. It's an amazing romp through the mountainside of Kyrat, as Sam and Chad dominate the local wildlife in search of adventure. Man those cuffin' Honey Badgers can eat a dick!

attributes.title: The Crew Embargoed, Dark Souls 2 Next-gen, Project Vaulderie Shutdown | Hard News 11/25/14
attributes.description: I'm Sean Hinz and this is Hard News for Tuesday November 25th, 2014Ubisoft has backtracked on its promises following the lackluster review process for Assassin's Creed Unity. After the post-launch embargo of Unity left some owners feeling cheated by all the glitches and overall poor design choices, Ubisoft said they were "working to adapt our services and communications with consumers accordingly”, in a show of good faith. In spite of this, Ubisoft has embargoed reviews for The Crew to be posted after the game launches next Tuesday. They claim this is due to the interconnected and open-world nature of the game, because "The Crew was built from the beginning to be a living playground full of driving fans, so it's only possible to assess our game in its entirety with other real players in the world." So this brings up a very big question, has the nature of being first to market on any review site cost consumers the privilege of fair and unbiased reviews? Or is Ubisoft blowing smoke up our ass so they can make sure their first week of sales is the best it can be?One game that needs no review is the visual novel Hatoful Boyfriend. The pigeon dating simulation is like no other game in its genre. Hell, it's like no other game on the market right now and that's why after its PC release, we'll be seeing it on PS4 and Vita. In it you attend the St. PigeoNation's Institute as the last human female on earth, looking for an avian lover like no other. PlayStation has been embracing the bizarre indie scene for quite awhile now, so it only makes sense this game would release on PSN in the second quarter of 2015. It has quite a few bizarre paths that can lead to interspecies erotica or flat-out murder. If you'd like a taste of either, check out our live stream with Craig, Andre, and Playboy Playmate Irina Voronina; as they make their way through the game. Yup… That happened.In more new game news, Bandai Namco revealed that Darks Souls II is coming to ravage next-gen consoles, with a new title to boot. Dark Souls 2: Scholar of the First Sin will launch on April 7, 2015 for PS4, Xbox One, and PC's with DirectX 11. It's a re-release and will include all three pieces of DLC, along with enhanced graphics and an increased player count for multiplayer. This is also be coming to PS3, Xbox 360, and PC's with DIrectX 9, but won't include the improvements, just bundling the content together. All versions will be getting the bonuses from update 1.1 which includes new NPCs, expanded story, in-game events and better matchmaking. Seems like today is a great day for fans of the franchise. See you on PS4 this April g1s!And lastly, the reboot of Vampire: The Masquerade - Bloodlines as a fan project no longer has approval from copyright holder CCP. They've unfortunately put a stop the project's development, because well, they could, causing a years worth of work to hit the dustbin. Project Vaulderie was actually trying to reinvigorate the franchise by creating this update that would require you to own the game to play the fan remake, but still enjoy the great content on newer PCs. This is an especially strange situation, because Project Vaulderie had actually been trying to ensure this wouldn't happen by reaching out to the publisher Activision and getting a non-commercial license for the game. But while Activision had the rights to publish the game, CCP actually became the owner of all future Vampire Masquerade content when the acquired the book publisher White Wolf. So they're totally boned… Thanks CCP!Our comment of the day comes Oliver Martinelli who asks "Did you know people in the UK don't celebrate thanksgiving?” Really? Why not? You managed to get rid of all those puritan douchebags and their belt buckle hats. That should totally be call for celebration. No go kill a local bird and enjoy pumpkin flavored everything.I'm Sean Hinz and THAT was Hard News!It's time for another installment in our DC Universe Online video series starring Foxitron, the greatest of all time. Chad and Parker engage in the foxening as they take on the Scarecrow. See his meteoric rise by clicking this window to my left.

attributes.title: PlayStation False Advertising, Crew Beta Live, Gamecube Adapter Homebrew | Hard News 11/26/14
attributes.description: I'm Sean Hinz and this is Hard News for Wednesday November 26th, 2014.    The Crew Beta has arrived on PS4 and Xbox One, and it is open to everyone! So for the next few days you login to your PSN or Xbox Live and download the Beta for free. If you have Gold or PlayStation Plus subscription, your experience should be vastly improved with all the multiplayer options available. This is a great opportunity to skip the reviews altogether and just play the game before release to see if it's something you want. GG Ubisoft.    Hmm… It was kind of nice to compliment them once.    In other news, Sony has been found guilty of false advertising according to the Federal Trade Commission based on a series of ads that ran between late 2011 into early 2012. The ads touted a number of features on the PlayStation Vita, that consumers found misleading. That means anyone who purchased a Vita before June 1, 2012 is eligible for ""either a $25 cash or credit refund, or a $50 merchandise voucher for select video games, and/or services."" The specific false claims seemed to mostly revolve around the Remote Play functionality and how the Vita communicates with the PS3. A feature that seems to work much better now that we have the PS4, so maybe Sony just was a little excited about the portable's potential. Either way, the functionality finally exists, but because Sony jumped the gun, we all get free shit! Now this isn't the first time Sony has lied to us, but it is the first time we've been paid for it.    With your new found fortune, you should consider checking out the Humble SEGA Bundle. It's a collection of some great SEGA games like NiGHTS Into Dreams, Sonic All-Stars, and the Dreamcast Collection. Throw in a couple more games and add-ons for the low low price of $3.50 and you have a nice little Steam bundle for the next few days. Oh and for the hardcore, you can pay $50 and get an exclusive t-shirt memorializing the dead console that is the Dreamcast.    And finally, on the subject of reviving the dead. Nintendo's foray into bringing back the Gamecube controller using the Wii U Adapter may have unlocked some secrets in the homebrew community. Michael Lelli is an engineer that experiments in modding and emulation as a hobby and might have figured out how to connect any controller to a Wii U. Michael purchased a $60 Linux board called a BeagleBone Black and through some clever reverse engineering of the Gamecube Adapter, determined the language used by peripheral connected to a Wii U. So now the BeagleBone can act as a bridge between ANY USB device and your Wii U. It still needs some programming before it can truly deliver on it's potential, but like Michael says, ""It would allow me to play Smash Bros. the way God intended; with a Steel Battalion controller.""    Our comment of the day comes from Gigi Villalobos who asks ""Why aren't you doing any game reviews anymore? Are you slacking off?” Well Gigi, the process of reviewing a game is actually quite costly and time consuming. But we here at ScrewAttack still want to participate in talking about all the newest releases, so stay tuned for a new show coming in 2015. And why aren't you posting anymore bumper car videos?    I'm Sean and THAT was Hard News.    To celebrate the impending holiday, head over to ScrewAttack's YouTube and check out Nick's Day of Hell. It's filled with hazing, clowns, and a twisted tale of vengeance. Oh and there are robots.

attributes.title: Game of Thrones Dated, China Console Revolution, From Russia with Amiibo | Hard News 12/1/14
attributes.description: I'm Sean Hinz and this is Hard News for Monday December 1st, 2014.Holy balls, Game of Thrones: A Telltale Game Series will be releasing on PC, Mac, and American PS4s tomorrow, December 2nd. Then on the third, it will hit Xbox 360, Xbox One, and European PS4s. Followed by iOS platforms on the fourth and on PS3 on the 9th of December. Android dates have yet to be revealed. Still no price, but this is episode one of six, so it probably won't cost much at all. That means if you've been trying to catch up on the franchise, you'd better hurry, there are mere hours left before launch.Unfortunately for the remaining staff at the publication CVG, they might be out of time. One of Future publishings last and longest running gaming websites will be closing its doors according to MCV. Considered for closure in May, Computer and Video Games didn't fit into the massive conglomerate created on GamesRadar and was given six months to make itself worthy, but after 33-years it will be closing up shop. Future has yet to disclose as much officially, but the largest gaming website in the UK will be giving up the ghost and it will probably happen before the end of the year. Here's hoping the American, Australian, and UK staffers all land on their feet.Now we're going to dig even deeper into the International gaming news by turning our gaze to Russia, where some amiibo owners claim they can access the Moscow subway using the NFC powered figurines. You can see this Samus is at least making the gate consider opening. But some are saying it's an elaborate hoax, in spite of the evidence. Who's to say this won't ignite a political conflict with neighboring Japan? And I know Russia can be stubborn, but they don't have shit on Nintendo! I think Putin is going to have to bite the bullet on this one and make some subway changes, because these figurines are here to stay.While we're on that side of the world, China has already begun its adventure into console gaming with the recent launch of the Xbox One, but times are tough for Microsoft's poster child. The launch of Xbox in China has generally underperformed and it hasn't seen much support in the way of games. After a couple rumors though, it appears Tencent will be publishing a complete version of the Infinity Blade franchise to the Chinese market on Xbone. You can see from the leaked video that it will support Kinect and higher graphical fidelity to make the mobile game look all pretty on your widescreen TV. As a major stakeholder in Epic Games, it should come as no surprise that Infinity Blade will be coming to Xbox One in China, but will it make its way to the West? I'm sure we'll found out once there is an official release.And in more unofficial Chinese gaming news, PlayStation 4 might be trying to kick Microsoft while they're down. Rumors from media sites like Sina.com and PcGames.Com.cn point to the PlayStation platform entering the market at 2,999 RenMinBi, which is 1200 less than the Xbox One launch price, with a Kinect. That's $213 cheaper for PS4, even if you get a motion-controller with your Xbone. Going Kinect-less will save you a benjamin, but that still won't make up the additional $113 you'd be spending on the Microsoft platform over Sony. Rumors also point to the PlayStation 4 being officially announced for China this month, with Sony China and the Shanghai Media Group at the helm. Ironically, Shanghai Media Group also runs the Xbox distribution in China, so no matter what, the State-affiliated media company wins. Sorry Microsoft…Now we'd normally have our comment of the day, but it's time for real-talk. As some of you may have heard on a recent episode of Sidescrollers, Hard News will be coming to an end on December 19th. It was a tough decision, but ultimately it will free me up to make more great content for you guys and keep the well oiled machine running. So be sure to stick around for some fun surprises in the coming weeks before our big send off! And since all good things must come to an end… Craig, mirror me!I'm Sean and THAT was Hard News!Hey thanks for sticking around after Hard News, why not take a moment to check out the latest One Minute Melee. This time featuring Zero from Mega Man X, against MetaKnight from Nintendo's beloved Kirby. It might not be a Death Battle, but it does have two pop culture icons beating the piss out of each other. Click this window to my left and see for yourself.

attributes.title: Xbox Live Down, Fortnite Alpha is Open, Barry Joins Revelations 2 | Hard News 12/2/14
attributes.description: I'm Sean Hinz and this is Hard News for Tuesday November 2nd, 2014    Really quick news bits, Peter Molyneux has a new game coming called The Trail. It will have you following a path of Reeses Pieces into a varmint snare, where he'll trap you and keep you in his private dungeon. To see what happens next you'll probably have to buy the DLC. And that ""defective” Samus figurine with dual arm cannons sold for a whopping $2500 on ebay. In other news, Nintendo says screw it and just begins to manufacture the rest of them that way. Onto the news!    Xbox Live was taken down by a DDoS attack last night. Users on Xbox 360 and Xbox One reported a ""80151909 error code — warning that an Xbox Live profile has failed to download”. Microsoft's support site didn't record there being an outage, but the Internet did and it seems to be coming from everyone's favorite reptilian hacker collective Lizard Squad, who took responsibility via Twitter. Attacks like these are becoming an all too common occurrence these days and Lizard Squad in the past claims to have used denial-of-service attacks against PSN, League, GTA Online, and even Destiny. BUT this time the hackers took it a step further, foreshadowing an even larger attack to come this Christmas holiday. That's the week of the Halo 5 BETA! Baby Jesus is gonna be pissed.    Maybe access to the Alpha test of the new game Fortnite will make him forget about his impending doom. Epic's latest IP is opening up sign-ups to the closed Alpha that kicks off today and runs through December 19th. It looks like the first wave of invites is out and since Fortnite is best played with buddies, it will let you bring two friends for the ride. The wave-based co-op shooter will have you building an epic fortress as you try to survive the most unholiest of nights. Interested in trying it first hand? Just follow the link in the description for the sign-up page. I wonder if Dom from Gears of War will make an appearance as an undead boss… SPOILERS!    Speaking of which, Barry Burton has been confirmed for the new Resident Evil: Revelations 2. His role in the franchise started at the beginning where he and the other S.T.A.R.S. members first encountered Umbrella's demented experiment. With this revelation of a new character comes the release date of February 17th for the first episode of the five episode series. What the deuce?! Yeah, apparently I missed the announcement that this sequel would be delivered episodically for $6 an episode. Following the launch on the 17th, expect one episode per week and you can bundle them up for $24.99 or snag a boxed copy for $39.99. Expect more Raid Mode DLC and levels as the game continues its post-launch support. Just don't expect too much from the franchise, we all saw what happened with RE6, Operation Raccoon City, and the entire movie franchise.    To follow up on our announcement yesterday, there were a handful of comments addressed at our new partners-in-crime Rooster Teeth being responsible for the departure of Hard News. They aren't. In fact, they probably aren't even aware of the decision. Yes, they run their own news channel called The Know and it's pretty good, but letting go of Hard News has been something we've struggled for quite sometime. So everyone be nice and don't worry, we have lots of exciting updates to ScrewAttack incoming.    I'm Sean and THAT was Hard News!

attributes.title: PS4 20th Anniversary, Assassin's Creed Leak, Steam Broadcasting | Hard News 12/3/14
attributes.description: I am Sean Hinz and this is Hard News for Wednesday December 3rd, 2014.We have tons of news to cover today so let's get started! Valve has decided that they can't let Twitch have all the fun when it comes to streaming games, so they're bringing the heat with Steam Broadcasting. The primary market seems focused on sharing live videos with friends, but it will have a public option for all of your fevered fans. You can watch the gameplay on Steam, Chrome, and Safari; but there are no archive options for the service at this time. I suspect that will change as the Beta evolves and to use the feature you'll have to opt-in to the Beta version of Steam. There doesn't seem to be any camera options either, maybe Valve just wants to keep the T&A to a minimum.Nintendo might be on the cusp of some major hardware issues with Wii U. Reddit has begun cataloguing a ton of instances where error code 160-0103 is bricking the hardware. Early reports were Smash was the culprit, but most seemed convinced that this isn't actually a software issue. User TVena suspects the error code is the result of a faulty or worn internal flash chip, most likely limited to a specific run off the factory line. It could be a firmware bug, but that would be even more random and unlikely. The point is Smash isn't responsible for the error code and you shouldn't be concerned playing your Wii U. It has enough problems of its own without us gamers feeling paranoid.In other news, Sony's PlayStation Experience is happening this weekend in Las Vegas and the manufacturer has announce a Limited Edition PlayStation 4 celebrating the 20th anniversary of the brand. And I want it so hard! Limited to a run of 12,300 units, this slick looking piece of hardware features the color scheme from the original PlayStation released back in 1994. It also comes packed with a sexy custom controller and camera, but there is no date or price. Expect more details to be revealed over the weekend. In the meantime, Sony uploaded a digital theme to PSN that harkens back to the original PlayStation era and you can download it on your PS4, PS3, and Vita RIGHT NOW. The PlayStation Blog in Europe is also reporting a sale on Classic titles, but keep an eye on the North American blog for a similar announcement. If you do happen to find yourself on PlayStation blog, be sure to check out "Between Shu Ferns”. Yes, it's a shameless rip-off of the Zach Galifianakis show, but it has its moments and is a fun way to promote the PlayStation Experience.Of all the stories covered today, the biggest has to be the leak of the upcoming Assassin's Creed for 2015. Kotaku got their hands on a seven minute gameplay video, that was used most likely as an internal pitch for Assassin's Creed Victory. It is set to take place in Victorian London sometime around the 19th century. In the video Kotaku reports a variety of new gameplay options such as the ability to swap from the hood to a top hat while disguising yourself in a crowd, swinging on a grappling hook through the city, and the ability to engage in combat atop moving vehicles. But not play as a female assassin, because remember, that's too hard. After the leak went live, Ubisoft confirmed to many outlets that the assets are in fact from the upcoming game being developed by their Quebec studios. That means there is another new team creating an installment in the franchise, giving Montreal a year or two off to figure out where to take the franchise next. What else Assassin's Creed Victory has in store for us is anyone's guess, but since we're hitting up the Industrial Revolution, I look forward to murdering the shithead who wouldn't give Oliver Twist some more.Speaking of pissed, our comment of the day comes from Azero Tehiro who speculates on why Hard News is coming to an end and really nails it in my opinion. I have taken an excerpt from it, but I recommend reading the full thing. "The new partner/competition shows that are now alongside Hard News simply made the heads of ScrewAttack think about their direction as a site in the interwebz. In the end, they decided that they shouldn't try to spread the jelly on the news side of the bread as well or else things would get too thin to really enjoy all the other parts of the game-toast. It's kind of understandable, considering all the latest news can be fetched via Twitter, Reddit etc. instantly nowadays via sites likes IGN, and Game Informer being are able to retrieve that press first-hand and sometime exclusively. ScrewAttack simply could not compete with that, as evident in how Hard News usually covered big video game news from the day before or even days prior. In exchange for Hard News, ScrewAttack's saving their new production show schedule for next year, January 2015, which will include Top 10s, Best Evers, Death Battle, Sidescrollers, random videos on the side, as well as 6 brand new shows.”Thanks Azero for wording that better than us and hopefully that will provide more clarification behind the decision and I'm gonna be in two of those new shows, so I'm not going anywhere.I'm Sean and THAT was Hard News.The latest episode of Sidescrollers is now live, so head on over to ScrewAttack.com and tune in for the weekly calamity that is our community focused podcast. Sam, Chad, and Craig are bearing their gaming souls, digging into big stuff, and breaking down the worst kickstarters going on right now! Just click this window to my left and see it for yourself.

attributes.title: YouPorn in eSports, Nintendo sued by Donkey Kong, Dan Adelman's New Game | Hard News 12/4/14
attributes.description: I'm Sean Hinz and this is Hard News for Thursday December 4th, 2014.Dan Adelman, the man who brought indie gaming to the Wii U, has finally found a new home with the developers of the upcoming roguelike Chasm. The developer Discord Games successfully completed a Kickstarter back in April of 2013 for Chasm, raising nearly $200,000 towards the indie title. This isn't the first Metroidvania title Adelman has helped, post his position at Nintendo, where he previously lent his expertise to Axiom Verge. Joking on his Blog, Adelman admits "there are definite similarities in terms of the genre and overall framework. Tight controls. Challenging boss fights and a wide range of enemies.” Sounds like either project would be a home run for fans of platformers. Chasm is now expected to release on PS4, PC, Mac, and Linux for the second half of 2015. While other platforms are under consideration, there is no confirmation of a Wii U release for either of Dan's current projects. Sorry Nintendo.Other not so great Nintendo news comes way of the LA Times who reports that a paid actor is suing the gaming giant for his role in the Spring of 2013 release Donkey Kong Country Returns 3D. Parker Mills was hired by Nintendo to rock a Donkey Kong costume at a local zoo to help promote the game. According to his lawyer, "Mills was denied breaks and not provided with the required ice pack to cool him down as he talked to zoo guests”. This created a "stressful environment” for Mills, who suffered an aortic dissection that required heart surgery and a permanent defibrillator. The lawsuit also claims that the company provided ambassador to help Mills did not provide "proper oversight”. Now his illness is unfortunate and temperatures might exceed 80 degrees around that time in LA, but let's be real honest here, Mills is just trying to milk that Nintendo teat before it dries up.And while we're talking boobies, YouPorn is the first company in the pornography business to sponsor an eSports gaming team. Hailing from Madrid, the Spanish eSports team Play2Win will now be known as Team YP in future competitions, including the upcoming Gamergy competition this weekend. There, Team YP will be competing in DOTA 2 to become the champions of the Internet. Brad Burns, VP of Porn at YouPorn had this to say about the partnership ""This partnership has been a long time coming, and I believe that with our backing, along with the expertise that each member of Team YP brings to the table on the virtual battlefield, we can succeed in tearing through the competition at this year's Gamergy event.” Well Brad, although everything you said is articulate and potentially accurate, it just sounds like more porn speak to me. And regardless of the outcome, this has to be the most relaxed eSports team in the world.Our comment of the day comes from Michael Platt who suggests "I really want to see you both guys (Rooster Teeth and Screwattack) get into a vs series.... Maybe for charity?”. Well Michael, we used to have ScrewAttack Versus the Internet and it might just be coming back round in 2015. I would stay tuned for more announcements in the New Year, when we head down to SXSWi in the Spring.I'm Sean Hinz and THAT was Hard News!If you have a free moment why not check out Five Fun Facts for Super Mario Bros. 3, the greatest video game of all time. Seriously, don't even try to debate otherwise. That would be impossible. Just click this window to my left and check it out for yourself.

attributes.title: Street Fighter V Leaks, SNK Classics on PSN, New Games at Game Awards | Hard News 12/5/14
attributes.description: I'm Sean Hinz and this is Hard News for Friday December 5th, 2014.  Dragon Ball Z is preparing yet another movie in the franchise to arrive in Japan on April 18 of next year. Dragon Ball Z: The Resurrection of F will feature everyone's favorite prince, Frieza. This footage features a handful of scenes in a loop on the Japanese morning show Mezamashi TV and it is the first time we've had a look at the anime. Will Funimation being this newest Dragon Ball stateside? Let's call Lauren and find out!  Well there you have it, Dragon Ball for everyone!  On thesubject of games for the people, SNK has taken over PlayStation Blog in order to have the community help vote on the next classic Neo Geo title to bring to PSN. Right now, Metal Slug 3 is launching on PS3, PS4 or Vita to will mark the 25th anniversary of the Neo Geo AES console and MVS arcade cabinets. New titles to vote on include King of Fighters, Fatal Fury, and Samurai Showdown. While they don't have Windjammers on the list, they do have Mark of the Wolves, so be sure to voice your opinion so we keep getting these great games!  Speaking of great games, Capcom may have just had their newest installment in the Street Fighter franchise leak for all of us to enjoy. Now most leaks come from some internal document or mole, but this one is all Capcom's fault, who posted the trailer on their YouTube and then promptly removed it. That didn't stop DailyMotion from keeping tabs on it though and what was probably going to be announced sometime over the next 72 hours, is now in the wild. Graphically it looks much like Street Fighter IV, but with more detailed character models who don't look quite as emotive. Ryu and Chun-li throw some kicks and punches between b-roll of FGC pros in what is almost a car commercial. Then the entire teaser ends with the explosive reveal of PS4 and PC platform exclusivity. I guess Sony looked at Microsoft's recent foray into the fighting game community with Killer Instinct and countered with the greatest fighting game franchise of all time. BOOM!  And this weekend is going to be a rife with new game announcements. Tonight Geoff Keighly will be holding the video game awards from Las Vegas, with Bryan and Craig are there as we speak. But the big news from the event won't be the winners, no the focus will be on the over 12 world premieres in-store for us. Including ""Bloodborne, Metal Gear Online, and the new King's Quest”. Additionally Sony is holding the PlayStation Experience the following 2 days and they have all kinds of stuff from No Man's Sky details, to whatever EMAGON is, and a mystery game or two. You can catch the Game Awards at 8 PM CST on every platform imaginable. We will be hosting the PlayStation Experience on our Twitch Channel and on the top of the site all weekend. You can find a complete schedule in the description.  Our comment of the day comes from toiletmunger who suggests, ""If the guy would have just waited a little bit so he could promote Tropical Freeze instead, Nintendo surely would have given him plenty of ice packs.?” Nailed it! Thanks for sticking it out with me through this tough week and look forward to a few surprises over the next two weeks.  I'm Sean and THAT was Hard News!  Hey thanks for sticking around after Hard News. Shaun and I played through some of the worst parts of Duke Nukem Forever on ScrewAttack Live last night. There were vibrators, tentacle porn, and a Battlelord.

attributes.title: DmC is Remastered, Hatred Pulled from Steam, Witcher 3 Features New Character | Hard News 12/16/14
attributes.description: I'm Sean Hinz and this is Hard News for Tuesday December 16th, 2014.Rockstar is finally prepared to make good on their promise by bringing Heists to GTA Online. The co-op mode offers you and three friends the opportunity to score some big cash by completing an elaborate series of objectives. While we still don't have a hard date, the latest trailer points to early 2015. Throw Vin Diesel, Val Kilmer, and George Clooney in a Mini Cooper and let's go rob a cruise ship!After the reveal of Street Fighter 2 crossover content, I thought for sure Capcom was trying to rob us of our dignity, but no, they just need our money. On top of the reveal of another Felyne customer from Devil May Cry, Capcom also announced two next-generation ports of the recently rebooted DmC and nearly the worst game in the franchise Devil May Cry 4. DmC Devil May Cry: Definitive Edition from Ninja Theory is everything from the previous generation all jammed onto one disc for $39.99. It features all the DLC, plus new modes, skins, and gameplay features for Xbox One and PS4. It will additionally boast the long sought after 1080p, 60 fps that the Internet is so enamored with these days. You can find this re-mastered version of DmC at retail or digital download on March 17th, of 2015. Devil May Cry 4 Special Edition will launch in the summer of 2015 and more details will be shared next year. Totally should have gone with Devil May Cry 3 guys. The style system was way more fun than that punk bitch Nero.More details have emerged about CD Projekt Red's newest protagonist in Witcher 3. Named Ciri, the character is referred to as a "living weapon”, who is essential to the story. Pursued by the Wild Hunt, players will be passed control of her at key points throughout the game. Witcher 3 PR mastermind Robert Malinowski says Ciri "has her own will and agenda, so it's not just finding her that counts. I think that is the most important aspect of this character. Geralt knows Ciri since she was a child. She's Geralt's apprentice and they have a close emotional bond”. Ahhh yesss, the old student/teacher emotional bond. I can't imagine why they aren't together anymore. Oh that's right, Geralt is smashing every chick in the kingdom.And finally Hatred and the terrifying subject matter it embodies won't be coming to Steam anytime soon. When the game launched its Greenlight campaign to have the game published on the world's most popular PC platform, Valve quickly took notice and decided to take matters into their own hands. Despite very quickly becoming the 7th most popular game on the service, Valve wanted us to know "that based on what we see on Greenlight we would not publish Hatred on Steam. As such we'll be taking it down.” Destructive Creations responded by saying they respect "Valve's decision” and his situation has inspired them to work harder to make the game we want. And while I myself enjoy some digital murder, this remains one of the most disturbing works of fiction I have ever laid eyes on. And I've seen Human Centipede 2.Our comment of the day comes from Jonathan Rodriguez who asks "Shawn, who do u think is cuter, regular Chun-Li or kitty Chun-Li? ;)” Ummm… Wait a tick. Your avatar is a Pikachu… with a mustache. That Pikachu has a fancy mustache! Making him way cuter than kitty kat Chun-li. I'm going to give him a top hat and monocle! You're welcome.I'm Sean and THAT was Hard News.If you haven't heard yet, ScrewAttack Games' next title Disorder had a new gameplay trailer launch and you can check it out right now on our dot com. It teases some new elements we've never shown before and finally gives the game an official release date for PC and Mac on Steam. You should click this window here to my left to see it for yourself.

attributes.title: Ultra SF IV gets Wild, Gabe saves Hatred, Ubisoft bones AssCreed... Again! | Hard News 12/17/14
attributes.description: I'm Sean Hinz and this is Hard News for Wednesday December 17th, 2014.Ultra Street Fighter IV had a "wild "update today, that has some of your favorite fighters embracing their more animal instincts. The DLC features new costumes, some of which are incredibly bizarre and others that give me a strange boner. Anyway... the selection is broken down in various packs, much like past costumed content and you can scoop them up individually for $4 a piece. Should you be a big spender, you can get all 44 costumes for $20. This DLC will be available following the version 1.04 patch featuring the wacky Omega Mode. Ugh the Sagat skin is awwwwfullll… Just like the price of this content.For the low low price of nothing, you can now download a patch that is supposed to make AssCreed Unity run as expected and fix "most” outstanding issues. But there's an issue.. to make the frame rate more stable, Ubisoft had to rework a few sections of Paris and that means everyone needs to download a nearly 7 GB patch. As much as we may bitch an moan about this, that is becoming a pretty awful trend these days. That is until the Xbox One version somehow completely crapped out and now requires you to redownload the entire game at a whopping 40GB! Now that's something to complain about. Ubisoft says "This is obviously not the expected behavior, and we apologize that many of you will have to wait longer than expected to complete this download.” But they don't have an ETA on a solution outside of this issue and are working with Microsoft to address this. Do you think Ubisoft has anymore DLC they can give away to make themselves feel better?Speaking of the big ‘M', it appears the project name for Microsoft's upcoming streaming service has leaked (thanks ZDnet), and they call it Arcadia. Using the Azure cloud, Microsoft hopes to offer its customers the ability to stream games and other content to Windows devices like say a Phone or low-end computer. When Polygon previously saw the ‘Rio' demonstration, Microsoft was able to stream Halo 4 to a Windows phone and connect a Xbox 360 controller. Assumably Arcadia would expand upon that and potentially offer up new features on Xbone, like backwards compatibility and some form of remote play. There was even an open discussion around streaming apps other than games, but that idea is not in the current timeline for Arcadia. Fun fact, Arcadia is the Unified Earth Gov colony from Halo Wars and the second instance a Microsoft product has been named after something in the Halo Universe. Just waiting on Phil Spencer to refer to himself as Master Chief and the exploitation of Bungie's masterpiece can reach an all time high.Lastly, it looks like Christmas miracles still happen because after hearing about Hatred being de-listed from Steam Greenlight, Santa Gabe stepped in and saved the day. In an open email to Destructive Creations, Gabe Newell had this to say about the situation. "Yesterday I heard that we were taking Hatred down from Greenlight. Since I wasn't up to speed, I asked around internally to find out why we had done that. It turns out that it wasn't a good decision, and we'll be putting Hatred back up. My apologies to you and your team. Steam is about creating tools for content creators and customers.” Obviously the devs were thrilled and it looks like Steam fans were too, because in the 7 hours that followed the game skyrocketed to the number one spot on the service. Maybe they'll even get publisher approval for Hatred before the holidays. "It's the most wonderful timeeee of the year.Our comment of the day comes from Jay Reyes "Hey NEwsman, Get your facts straight and STOP ASSUMING SHIT. FOr FUcks SAke. ................... DMC 4 WAs AWEsome. DMC 5 is Good, but not that bad. GEt-YOur-Facts-STRAIGHT.” Hey Jay, my name is Sean. I say it at the start of EVERY episode and just so you know, those two comments on DmC are called opinions, just like my opinion that Devil May Cry 4 isn't MY favorite. Sorry if you don't agree that 3 is a better game, but that's why opinions are like assholes, everyone has one.I'm Sean and THAT was Hard News!I you're looking for something special for that special someone, how about the exclusive ScrewAttack hoodie for 2014? RIght now we're doing a limited run of this Pokemon themed magical garb and you can scoop one up right now by just clicking this window to my left. Please know that we will only be running this item for print between now and December 31st, so its availability is limited. How majestic!

attributes.title: Steam Controller Update, New Evolve Monster, Sony Cancels The Interview | Hard News 12/18/14
attributes.description: Mojang and the crew at Telltale Games surprised everyone on the Internet today with the announcement of Minecraft Story Mode. The partnership aims to generate narrative-driven content for the franchise in traditional Telltale fashion, i.e. episodic content to be released on Xbox Live, PSN, PC, Mac, iOS, and Android devices. They will do their best to keep the game as "Minecrafty” as possible, even going as far as to make this announcement using an interactive press release called Info Quest II and teasing the launch of Minecraft 2. Just FYI, there is no Minecraft 2. Anyhoo, Mojang clarifies that they're "not intending on creating an "official” story for Steve, or explaining the world of Minecraft in detail. It will be a cool game.” This looks to be the first major initiative at Mojang since Microsoft purchased them and the Minecraft franchise earlier this year. Commence the hating Debbie downers!But don't you dare hate on the latest Steam controller leak. What was previously a boombox for your hands is quickly morphing into a more "traditional” gamepad. The latest leak points to the addition of a d-pad in the left haptic area and if you'd forgotten, a set of face buttons has already been replaced by an analog stick. While this certainly isn't a finalized retail build, it does point to the notion that the controller, much like Steam Machines, will be customizable. So if you don't like rubbing those areolas on your Steam Controller to play Street Fighter V, then it looks like you can slap a pastie on dem titties. Mmmm… Boob controller.In OTHER news, Evolve has revealed the third monster coming to the hunt in 2015. Known as the Wraith, the monster seems incredibly fast and even more deceptive than its brethren. A trailer released by 2K shows its incredible speed and ability to spawn a decoy, opening up the team of hunters to be flanked. Like Kraken, it looks to be a flying type with massive scythes on his shoulders. Turtle Rock continued this information dump by teasing an open beta for Xbox One starting on January 15th and 48 hours later they'll add in the recently revealed Evacuation mode. All progress made in the open beta will carry over to the game when it launches in February and it will feature a dozen maps, eight hunters, and two monsters. Closed betas will arrive on the 16th for PC and 17th for PS4. When the game launches in February, it will support an offline mode and 2K even released a cheeky demonstration video. Too bad they forgot that Microsoft needs to verify you own the game EVERY. 24. HOURS.Finally, Suny Picturezzz is decided to like not not cancel dat crazy mofo ass premiere of an Interview picture with moving pictures because of that supreme leader of North Korea. My lord. And. Savrior. Kum Jang-in threatened. A local movieplex with an nuclear donkey punch. wait. what? a nuclear pigeon doo doo. stare blankly at camera. noap…. I meanzzzzz a nucleeer torpeda and den haxed Sooney's internetz and stuffz. This werk of story cost $forty-four millian Bison Dollars and will never be xposed to ‘mEricA. DAYAM Jeana! 4four fat billz is sum seriouz. CASH HOMY. *look at sean* but the Internetz think Sanie sux anywhyz. Sumthang about dat 1first amindment rites & free-speach and terrorists…Ahhh screw this… I know my bit is someone else writes and I go in blind but calm your shit, people. Sony's canceling The Interview after a terrorist threat on theaters, possibly from North Korea. They're sacrificing millions of dollars to protect lives on Christmas of all days. Sure, this sucks, the movie looks fun. But with all the other crap Sony's been through lately, it'd be careless to just laugh this off. Does this mean the terrorists win? . . . it's a freakin' movie, people. Let's fight our battles where they really count. The situation is too complex to set a precedent for repeat, anyway. Soooo Christmas is saved, and keep an eye out for The Interview's red carpet premiere on every torrent site.Our comment of the day comes from Seamelody who asks "Did you know that what gave you a strange boner was actually a dude?” WHAT?! But as I explained in our Worst Ever Sexy Chicks, Capcom confirmed that Poison was a girl again. I just don't know what to believe anymore… oh and for the record, you'd be surprised at what give Sean a strange boner.And finally, with Hard News coming to an end I wanted to personally thank you, our wonderful audience, for watching this crazy show for the last almost 7 years. When we launched Hard News back in 2008, it was the very first daily gaming news show online and man, has it been an adventure to see the show evolve over the years. We take great pride in that Hard News was the first. ScrewAttack has always been an innovator in the world of online video, daring to try new things before that thing was even a thing. So with that said, we're going to be taking that same maverick attitude and putting it into several other new shows for your enjoyment starting in January. Give them a watch and maybe, just maybe you'll be able to enjoy them as much as you have enjoyed Hard News. Thanks to Destin, Corey, Jared, Chad, Sean, Ben, Nick, Sam and everyone else who sat behind the Hard News desk. You've helped make Hard News and ScrewAttack what it is today.

attributes.title: The Final Episode | Hard News 12/19/14
attributes.description: I'm Sean Hinz and this is Hard News for Friday December 19th, 2014.Despite all the good will Santa Gabe has been pumping into the Holiday pipeline, it looks like Valve will be taking a little back this season. For as long as I could remember, Steam was always a region-free platform meaning you could by games in one country and gift them to a friend in another. That feature was also exploited by users in countries, who for various reasons, found their copies of Steam games to be much cheaper than most. Now due to Russia being on the brink of a recession as the Ruble's value plummets, Valve has decided to rectify this age old issue of price-dodging by no longer allowing you to gift Steam games across regions. So anyone hoping that the collapse of the Russian economy would some how help them get cheap games is shit out of luck. While I don't blame Valve for being proactive, this also means that any friendos you have overseas that you planned to buy Steam games for the holiday, just had their gifts tied up in digital customs. Santa Gabe help us, you're our only hope!If you're looking for some new and cheap games this holiday, there were quite a few reveals yesterday. Halo 5: Guardians multiplayer beta is arriving for most Xbone owners on the 29th, but if you're in the Preview Program it is live today. You'll have all weekend to get ahead of your buddies before the new year. Nintendo revealed that Duck Hunt would arrive on the eShop Christmas day, so dust off that Wiiimote and show that dog what you're made of. Halfbrick is so excited about the holiday season, that you can scoop up their entire catalog on iOS for free. I've always felt they made some of the best mobile games around, so consider picking up Jetpack Joyride, Fish Out of Water!, and Colossatron ASAP. Oh and Fruit Ninja, but I figure everyone owns that by now. And there's just one more game, starring Devolver Digital's CFO Fork Parker that launched yesterday. He is going to try and cut you a deal in Fork Parker's Holiday Profit Hike, a vertical sidescroller a la Ice Climbers, released on Steam for free. It's short, but has a high-replay value. Merry Christmas!Finally, If you haven't heard, that guy who created Minecraft is stinking rich. I mean, Notch is like "I just bought a mansion in Beverly Hills for $70 million” rich. Why is this newsworthy? Well he set a record for the most expensive property purchase in an area known for expensive property and he did so with a winning bid, beating out music tycoons Jay-Z and Beyonce. BOOM! VIDEO. GAMES. A quick tour of the property shows just how rich he is, like the panoramic glass wall overlooking downtown LA and Notch's new infinity pool. Or how about the many specialized rooms like a wine cellar, movie theater, candy room and vodka bar. Oh and let's not forget it is fully furnished with Bentley pillows, a replica James Dean motorcycle and a light machine gun dipped in chrome. I can't help but feel like I should have gone into game development…Our comment of the day comes from many of you in the g1Nation looking for direction now that the show has ended. Before you go some other channel, here's my two cents. I came to ScrewAttack in 2011 to help build a larger news presence on the dot com. While we we're quite successful for awhile, we came to the realization that news was a tough racket. So as times changed we began to focus more and more on videos. I helped bring SGC back, becoming the company wide event planner, and even had my own show called Nerdtastic. At least for a little while. When I took over Hard News last November, it was only to be a temporary solution, but in the past year I've shot over 250 episodes and accumulated around 8.5 million views. That will forever be one of the highlights of my career in games and I cannot thank you enough for your love and support. To be clear, I'm NOT leaving ScrewAttack, just taking on a larger business roll behind the scenes. If you want to continue supporting me, follow my Twitter, Instagram, Facebook, Vine; subscribe to me on YouTube, where in 2015 I might be doing some news stuff on my own time; and as always you can find me on ScrewAttack where I am hosting a new podcast next year, appearing in shows like Best Ever, Is it Good?, and other random awesome videos. Oh and don't worry, SGC 2015 will be bigger and more badass than ever. Until then I hope you have a Merry Christmas and Happy New Year!I'm Sean and THAT was Hard News!
